newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan stocks end down, but off early lows.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan stocks end down, but off early lows.

text.p: Pakistan stocks ended down on Wednesday, but were off early lows as select blue chips rose towards the close on speculative buying on the settlement day, dealers said.

"Early losses were cut as some blue chips gained on short-covering by speculators," dealer Sajjad Mankani said. "The stock prices are likely to gain on Thursday, the new accounts day, as levels are attractive."
The Karachi Stock Exchange (KSE) 100-share index fell 6.95 points, or 0.45 percent, to end at 1,525.92 after plunging to 1,518.43 in early trade. Losers led gainers 196 to 63.
Turnover fell to 63.25 million shares from 63.68 million on Tuesday.
Hub Power rose 0.60 to 37.30 rupees and ICI Pakistan 0.15 to 22.80. PTCL fell 0.95 to 25.35.
